com.urbancode.ubuild.scripting.notifications
Interface NotificationTemplateScripting

public interface NotificationTemplateScripting

 The variables that are available to Notification Event scripts vary by the type of event that the script is associated with.
 All scripts have access to:
     dateTool: Velocity's DateTool object that can be used to work format dates or get the month, day, year of the date, etc.
     properties: Used to check or retrieve property values
     recipients: Used to generate lists of recipients for the notification
     reports: Used to run reports and access the results

 When the event is an Agent Status Changed event:
     agent: Used to access information about the agent, such as the name, ID, and any properties that the agent may have

 When the event is a Build Deleted event:
     buildLifeId: The ID of the build life that was deleted
     user: Used to access information about the user that deleted the build life, such as the username and ID
     project: Used to access information about the project that the build life was in, such as the name and ID
     process: Used to access information about the process that the build life was in, such as the name and ID

 When the event is a Build Status Applied event:
     date: The date the status was applied
     trace: Used to access information about the job trace, such as the name, ID, and the status
     buildLife: Used to access information about the build life, such as the name ID, or the status
     status: Used to check if the applied status was a success status, failure status, or a custom status
     project: Used to access information about the project that the build was in, such as the name and ID

     If the status was applied through a process, the following are also available:
         process: Used to get information about the process that the build is in, such as the name and ID
         workflow: Used to get information about the process execution, such as the status, build life, and duration
         request: Used to get information about the build request, such as the ID, status, and the user that made the request

 When the event is a Build Request Failed or a Build Not Needed event:
     process: Used to get information about the process that the build is in, such as the name and ID
     request: Used to get information about the build request, such as the ID, status, and the user that made the request

     If the build request created a build life, the following is also available:
         buildLife: Used to access information about the build life, such as the name ID, or the status

 When the event is a Workflow End event:
     project: Used to access information about the project that executed the build, such as the name and ID
     process: Used to get information about the process that executed the build, such as the name and ID
     workflow: Used to get information about the process execution, such as the status, build life, and duration
     request: Used to get information about the build request, such as the ID, status, and the user that made the request

     If the workflow created a build life, the following is also available:
         buildLife: Used to access information about the build life, such as the name ID, or the status
